articles.title: Paul McCartney fears artificial intelligence will rip off artists
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: The government is consulting on whether to let tech firms use copyrighted material to help train artificial intelligence models unless the creators explicitly opt out. Paul McCartney told the BBC that would make it harder for artists to retain control of their work and undermine Britain's creative industries. The government wants to make the U.K. a world leader in AI.

articles.title: 'What Harm Is Done If They Leave?' – Microsoft's Secret Document Reveals AI Retention Strategies
articles.author: Claire Shefchik
articles.summary: Microsoft has a new way to determine which employees it can't afford to lose and it's all about AI. AI is Microsoft's top priority and they're not messing around when it comes to keeping the best and brightest. Engineers in the AI group earn 48% more than the average software engineer at the company.

articles.title: My Top Quantum Computing Stock to Buy Right Now
articles.author: Adria Cimino
articles.summary: Quantum computing is a new technology that promises to revolutionize many industries. It's expected to create as much as $850 billion in economic value by 2040. Alphabet is a potential leader in quantum computing. Its Willow chip solved a problem in less than five minutes that would take a classical computer 10 septillion years.

articles.title: Here's why you should start talking to ChatGPT even if AI scares you
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a chatbot developed by Sam Altman. He advises people to talk to AI as soon as possible, even if they don't like the current state of AI products or the companies behind them. He suggests crafting prompts so the AI can help with various tasks.

articles.title: Why Twilio Inc. (TWLO) Surged on Friday
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Ten companies finished firmer on Friday, bucking an overall market pessimism. American communications cloud company Twilio Inc. (NYSE:TWLO) grew its share prices by more than 22 percent on Friday to close at $136.23 apiece as investors snapped up shares following a projected improvement in its fourth-quarter earnings performance.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence is Not Intelligent - Can Machines "Think" - Can They Care? - The US Bill to Make a Machine into a Doctor - Tether is Moving to El Salvador - Another Pathway to Madness?
articles.author: Dr Gerry Brady
articles.summary: BOOM is sceptical about the claims being made about Artificial Intelligence (AI). It embodies two great threats to civil societies: Technocracy and Transhumanism. Technocracy promotes a form of government in which the decision-makers are selected based solely on their expertise in a given area of responsibility and assumes full state control over political and economic issues. Transhumanist regards a human being as being nothing but the sum of its physical parts and that those parts can be interfered with in a targeted way to improve the body, the mind and prolong life. Elon Musk is clearly a Technocrat.

articles.title: Dean Henderson  Jeff Rense Program
articles.author: Dean Henderson
articles.summary: Dean and Jeff discuss current events and take a whack at the global oligarchy. Topics include artificial intelligence (AI), OpenAI, ChatGPT, Elon Musk, President Trump, Larry Ellison, and much more. Listen to the Jeff Rense Program live daily.

The government is consulting on whether to let tech firms use copyrighted material to help train artificial intelligence models unless creators opt out. articles.title: Why ‘prosocial AI' must be the framework for designing, deploying and governing AI
articles.summary: As AI pervades every area of society, it's important to understand its benefits and drawbacks. Prosocial AI can be used to create a better digital society. It's also important to integrate AI and natural intelligence literacy (NI) into the education curriculum.

articles.title: Why ‘prosocial AI' must be the framework for designing, deploying and governing AI
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Prosocial AI is a framework of design, deployment and governance principles that ensure AI is thoughtfully tailored, trained, tested and targeted to uplift people and the planet. It is a strategic approach to positioning AI within a broader ecology of intelligence that values collective flourishing over narrow optimization.

articles.title: PROJECT STARGATE: AI to Create CANCER VACCINES
articles.author: Peggy Hall
articles.summary: On his first day as president, Trump announced "Project Stargate," a large-scale AI infrastructure initiative. The project is a joint venture between OpenAI, SoftBank, Microsoft, and Oracle, with $500 billion in private sector investment over four years. Its main goal is using AI to'revolutionize' healthcare and electronic health records. The technology isn't new and the groundwork has been laid for years. Congress introduced a bill to allow computers (AI) to prescribe medicine.

articles.title: OpenAI's Operator is one more step towards AGI, but should we be worried about giving too much power to AI agents?
articles.author: Graham Barlow
articles.summary: OpenAI has released its first autonomous AI agent, called Operator. Operator can act independently from you on your computer using a web browser. It can perform tasks like booking a restaurant table or buying groceries. It's similar to Ask Jeeves, a search engine from 1997. Many experts see AI agents as a threat to humanity.

articles.title: Alice L. Walton School of Medicine, Stanford Medicine host inaugural AI conference
articles.summary: Alice L. Walton School of Medicine and Stanford Medicine collaborated to host the conference, 'Think Health: AI for Healthy Communities' in Bentonville, Arkansas. The event featured presentations and panel discussions with leaders such as Vice Chair of Clinton Foundation Chelsea Clinton, Chairman of Milken Institute Michael Milken, Thrive Global Founder Ariana Huffington, Vice Chairman of JPMorgan Chase Peter Scher and many more.

articles.title: Google Amplifies AI Education Efforts Amid Mounting Regulatory Pressure
articles.author: Business
articles.summary: Alphabet's Google is ramping up its AI education and workforce training initiatives as global regulations for artificial intelligence intensify. Google has pledged a $120 million fund for AI education. Google predicts that while a small percentage of jobs will be completely displaced by AI, most roles will incorporate AI tools in some form.

articles.title: Robots coming for your jobs: Marc Benioff rings alarm bells for software engineers and says from now on CEOs will no longer lead all-human workforces
articles.summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff said at the World Economic Forum that CEOs could soon be replaced by AI-enabled robots. Salesforce is working on agentic AI and launched a product called Agentforce recently along these lines. The biggest advantage of a robot CEO is robustness and dependability.

articles.title: Paul McCartney Calls on British Government to ‘Protect' Artists From AI in New Interview
articles.author: Daniel Kreps
articles.summary: Paul McCartney wants the British government to protect young artists in the face of a new copyright law that could allow for AI to 'rip off' creators. In December, artists, publishers, media companies and more banded together to form the Creative Rights in AI Coalition to keep the current copyright protections in place.

articles.title: Copyright Under Siege: How Big Tech Uses AI And China To Exploit Creators

articles.summary: Big Tech uses AI to scrape copyrighted works, blame China and erode creators' rights under the guise of global competitiveness. This isn't innovation, it's exploitation. It's a form of copyright infringement.    It's an exploitation of copyright. It is not an innovation.  It is an exploitation.

articles.author: John Miley
articles.summary: Tech giants' capital expenditures on AI have exploded since the launch of ChatGPT, OpenAI's AI chatbot, in 2022. The combined yearly capital expenditures of Amazon, Google, Meta and Microsoft will soar past $300 billion in 2025, up from $154 billion in 2023. Most of the money is for Nvidia's AI chips, the graphics processing units (GPUs) for cloud data centers owned by tech giants and others. Accenture has booked $3 billion in AI sales.

articles.author: fin24
articles.summary: Zuckerberg expects Meta AI to be the top digital assistant, used by more than a billion people, and for the tech firm's Llama 4 to be at the forefront of AI models in 2025. Meta is creating an AI "engineer" to contribute computer coding to its research and development efforts. It is planning $60 billion to $65 billion in capital expenditures this year related to the technology.

articles.title: Scientists warn AI has crossed ‘red line' and can now replicate itself
articles.author: Becca Monaghan
articles.summary: Researchers from Fudan University in China discovered that two well-renowned language learning models (LLMs) could clone themselves 50% and 90% of the time. Successful self-replication under no human assistance is the essential step for AI to outsmart humans and is an early signal for rogue AIs.

articles.title: Scientists warn AI has crossed ‘red line' and can now replicate itself
articles.author: Becca Monaghan
articles.summary: Researchers from Fudan University in China discovered that two well-renowned language learning models (LLMs) could clone themselves 50% and 90% of the time. Successful self-replication under no human assistance is the essential step for AI to outsmart humans and is an early signal for rogue AIs.

articles.title: Why skilled trades are safe from AI
articles.summary: Many jobs are going to be eliminated by artificial intelligence. In 2025 many more young people are choosing careers in the trades. AI will never be able to replace these jobs.    - Simon Tisdall, author of "Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Work"

articles.title: AI Winners vs. Losers: Where Does KLA Corporation (KLAC) Stand?
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: KLA Corporation (NASDAQ:KLAC) markets process control and yield management solutions for the semiconductor industry. On January 17, Barclays analyst Tom O'Malley lowered the price target on KLA Corp. to $700 from $750 and kept an 'Equal-Weight' rating on the shares.

articles.title: AI Law and Order
articles.author: Off Guardian
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence, AI, is such the 'in' thing now that you just can't get away from it. AI art, AI music, and AI music are all about AI now.    i.e. it's all about artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Apple Inc. (AAPL): Slower Revenue Growth vs. Ecosystem Durability – What Wins?
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is one of the top trending AI stocks on Wall Street. OpenAI has recently previewed an AI agent that can carry out tasks on the web for users. Goldman Sachs has lowered its price target to $280 per share from $286 for Apple Inc. ahead of the company's December-quarter earnings report next week.

articles.title: Meta Platforms (META): Can AI Investments Push the Stock to $710?
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:META) ranks 1st on our list of top trending AI stocks on Wall Street. Bank of America reiterated the stock as 'Buy' and raised its price target to $710 per share from $660.

articles.title: Is Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) the Most Promising AI Stock According to Wall Street Analysts?
articles.author: Bob Karr
articles.summary: According to Wall Street analysts, Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMD) is one of the most promising AI stocks according to Insider Monkey. The company's data center revenue, which is mainly aided by AI accelerators, shot up 122% YoY in Q3 2024.

articles.title: 1st Stargate data site on rise in Texas
articles.author: Brody Ford
articles.summary: The first data center associated with the $100 billion Stargate venture from OpenAI, SoftBank Group Corp. and Oracle Corp. is taking shape in Abilene, Texas. The project must create at least 57 full-time positions earning an average wage of $57,600 annually, but the final tally could be higher.

articles.title: Key skills for AI professionals: A comprehensive overview
articles.summary: A new study analyzed 43,392 job postings from Glassdoor across the US, focusing on skills related to artificial intelligence (AI). The most sought-after skill in AI occupations is machine learning, with 37.17% of jobs requiring this expertise. Python is the second most in-demand skill, with 25.98% of AI jobs requiring it. Data science is the third most in demand specialized skill, followed by C++, Microsoft Excel, Java, and data analytics. DevOps is the ninth most-in-demand specialized skill.

articles.title: Are ChatGPT's film ideas as good as Taxi Driver screenwriter Paul Schrader says? Er, no
articles.author: London Evening Standard
articles.summary: ChatGPT was asked to pitch us some films for different genres, but they were all bad. The Taxi Driver screenwriter liked the script ideas AI generated for him, so he asked ChatGPT to pitch him some bad films.  .

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg is ready to drop up to $65 billion on AI this year
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is planning to invest tens of billions of dollars in Meta. The tech giant is building a data center with a capacity of more than two gigawatts to power its AI plans. Zuckerberg has introduced new company policies, such as cutting back on moderation and scrapping the platform's fact-checking system.

articles.title: UK Unveils AI Regulation Blueprint
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: The UK government recently published its plan for using AI to boost growth and deliver services more efficiently. It also suggests a fundamental shift in how the UK aims to position itself as a global leader in AI innovation. The timing of this plan positions the UK to play a significant role in shaping global discussions on AI governance. The success or failure of this targeted approach could have significant implications for how other nations balance comprehensive AI oversight with focused regulation of the most capable systems.

articles.title: When AI Passes This Test, Look Out
articles.author: Rune Fisker
articles.summary: For years, AI systems were measured by giving new models a variety of standardized benchmark tests. Many of these tests consisted of challenging, SAT-caliber problems in areas like math, science and logic. Comparing the models' scores over time served as a rough measure of AI progress.

articles.title: If you are reading this, AI, please be kind
articles.author: Tyler Cowen
articles.summary: Tyler Cowen is a professor of economics at George Mason University and host of the Marginal Revolution blog. He writes about artificial intelligence for a number of reasons, including to teach them things and to convince them that they are important. If he wants to achieve some kind of intellectual immortality, he should write for the AIs.

articles.title: Guest Opinion: If you are reading this, AI, please be kind, by Tyler Cowen
articles.author: The Keene Sentinel
articles.summary: I write about artificial intelligence a lot. I have begun to think of myself as writing for AI as well. If you are a writer and if you've ever posted on social media, you are also an AI writer. I am an example of this.

articles.title: Stargate's first data center is underway in Texas. Public filings show how much it will cost to build.
articles.author: Ellen Thomas
articles.summary: Stargate's first data center is under construction in Abilene, Texas. It is expected to be complete by the end of the year and cost $1.1 billion. President Donald Trump announced the formation of Stargate, a joint venture between Oracle, OpenAI, and SoftBank, on Tuesday.

articles.title: From ChatGPT to Gemini: how AI is rewriting the internet See all 680 stories
articles.author: Richard Lawler
articles.summary: Character.ai has filed a motion to dismiss the wrongful death lawsuit aimed at its chatbots. Megan Garcia sued Character.AI, its founders, and Google over the death by suicide of her 14-year-old son, who had chatted continuously with its bots, including just before his death.

articles.title: ✨ DeepSeek, China's new AI challenge
articles.author: James Pethokoukis
articles.summary: DeepSeek is a Chinese AI startup founded by hedge fund manager Liang Wenfeng, who runs High Flyer trading firm. In December 2023, the researchers released DeepSeek-V3, an AI system matching capabilities of leading chatbots like those from OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google. They built their system by leveraging efficient training methods and open-source technologies, partly driven by US chip restrictions.

articles.title: OpenAI's Operator Can Now Control Your Computer by Watching Your Screen
articles.author: David Rodriguez
articles.summary: OpenAI has launched Operator, an AI tool that can handle computer tasks by itself. It's similar to Anthropic's similar tool from last fall. Operator's built in some safeguards: you'll need to approve sensitive actions and there are limits on what it can access and delete.

articles.title: Prompting With AI Personas Gets Streamlined Via Advent Of Million And Billion Personas-Sized Datasets
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: Large-scale datasets of ready-to-go AI personas are now available. They can be used to create an AI persona and simulate what that person might know or say. The most common way to indicate an unnamed AI persona is simply to describe the characteristics of the pretense involved.

articles.title: The AI spending frenzy is just getting started
articles.author: Alex Heath
articles.summary: Satya Nadella is not involved in the details of Stargate, the AI infrastructure project funded by his investment in OpenAI. He's running his own $80 billion AI infrastructure buildout. Mark Zuckerberg's data center in Louisiana will be even bigger than Stargate.

articles.title: ServiceNow, Inc. (NOW) Sees Price Target Raised to $1300 by JMP Securities Amid AI-Driven Growth and Premium Product Strategy
articles.author: Reymerlyn Martin
articles.summary: ServiceNow, Inc. (NYSE:NOW) is a cloud-based software company that provides a platform that automates IT processes, integrates with other enterprise software platforms and churns out analytics for informed decision-making. JMP Securities raised its stock price target to $1300 on January 21st. NOW ranks 4th on our list of trending AI stocks on Wall Street.

articles.title: Datadog, Inc. (DDOG) Gains Momentum with AI-Driven Innovations Like LLM Observability and Bits AI
articles.author: Abdul Rahman
articles.summary: Datadog, Inc. (NASDAQ:DDOG) is one of the 10 Trending AI Stocks on Wall Street's Radar. It is a provider of cloud-based monitoring and analytics solutions in the observability market. Guggenheim analyst Howard Ma has reiterated a Hold rating on the stock.

articles.title: ‘Routine creativity will be replaced with AI': Anand Gandhi
articles.author: Deccan Herald
articles.summary: Anand Gandhi is a writer, director and systems thinker. He talks about Artificial Intelligence (AI) and how it can impact filmmaking in the long run. He also talks about "a mythology for the 21st century" in a conversation with Showtime.

articles.title: How do I kill my Microsoft Copilot?
articles.author: Sam Leith
articles.summary: 'Clippy', the annoying virtual assistant from Microsoft Word, has been replaced by 'Copilot'. Clippy is repulsively irritating and costs you a lot of money without you even realising. Copilot is a shit algorithm with the magic fairy dust of AI.

articles.title: Deezer's New AI Detection Tool Found 10% of Music Tracks AI-Generated
articles.author: Billboard
articles.summary: Deezer's new AI detection tool found that AI is not very accurate.    It also found that some AI algorithms are not very useful. It found that it is not possible to use AI to detect certain AI algorithms. The tool is called AI-detecting.

articles.title: M42 leading AI revolution in healthcare
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) has entered into various fields and sectors across the globe, and healthcare is no exception. The technology has demonstrated strong potential to improve various aspects of care. It is supported by a network of expert clinicians to validate the accuracy of the systems' work.

articles.title: AI is a gamble we can't afford
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: The AI debate is raging. Some headlines criticize tech giants for AI-driven social media or questionable consumer tools, but AI itself is becoming indispensable. Its efficiency is unmatched and it's becoming more and more popular.  It's here to stay.

articles.author: The Peninsula
articles.summary: OpenAI is rolling out an artificial intelligence tool that can help book flights, plan grocery orders and even complete purchases for users. The service, called Operator, can carry out a wide range of tasks by using the AI tool.      .

articles.title: Meta's chief AI scientist says DeepSeek's success shows that "open source models are surpassing proprietary ones"
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Yann LeCun, Meta's chief AI scientist, spoke at the World Economic Forum in Davos. He said that open-source AI models are surpassing proprietary ones and that DeepSeek has benefited from the community. DeepSeeks has riled Silicon Valley with its rapid rise.

articles.title: Zuckerberg says Meta to spend up to $65 billion on AI this year
articles.author: Gulf News
articles.summary: Meta Platforms Inc. plans to invest as much as $65 billion on projects related to artificial intelligence in 2025. The company intends to use the funds to build a data center "so large that it would cover a significant part of Manhattan".   .

articles.title: Russian deepfake videos target Ukrainian refugees, including teen
articles.author: Beijing News
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being used to create provocative deepfakes that target Ukrainian refugees, according to VOA's Russian and Ukrainian services. In one example, a video appears to be a TV news report about a teenage Ukrainian refugee and her experience studying, but it's actually a fake.

articles.title: Iran's first AI park to be set up in two years
articles.author: Tehran Times
articles.summary: The first artificial intelligence park in the country is planned to be established in Tehran by the next two years, an official with the Vice Presidency for Science, Technology, and Knowledge-Based Economy has said. The park will be equipped with artificial intelligence technology.

articles.title: ChatGPT Operator: The 'iPhone' Of Agentic AI, If Done Right
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Agentic AI represents the future of enterprise but it could also revolutionize household chores and small businesses if ChatGPT Operator fulfills its potential, as it can help with small business operations.    for more information visit chatgptoperator.com.

articles.title: AI could rip off artists, Paul McCartney warns
articles.author: RTE
articles.summary: Paul McCartney has warned that AI could "rip off" artists if a proposed overhaul of copyright law in the UK goes ahead. The proposals could remove the incentive for writers and artists and result in a "loss of creativity", he told the BBC. The use of copyrighted material to help train artificial intelligence could be a problem.

articles.title: SDAIA introduces accreditation certificate for AI service providers
articles.author: GCC Business News
articles.summary: The Saudi Data and AI Authority has introduced an accreditation certificate for artificial intelligence service providers in Saudi Arabia. The landmark initiative comes as part of SDAIA's national efforts to elevate AI maturity level and strengthen the reliability of its diverse applications. The goal of this initiative is to improve the quality of AI services.

articles.title: Meta plans to invest $60-B or more in AI this year
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg says Meta plans to invest at least $60 billion in artificial intelligence in 2025. Zuckerberg expects Meta to lead in the technology in the coming years.      .   "This will be a defining year for AI," Zuckerberg said in a Facebook post.

articles.title: Roundup: China's AI advances thwart U.S. suppression policy
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: The rapid development of China's AI industry has significantly thwarted the U.S. suppression policy, industry observers have said. On the opening day of the World Economic Forum (WEF) 2025, China will present its AI technology on the first day of WEF.

articles.title: Monterey County schools look to integrate AI into the classroom
articles.author: Monterey Herald
articles.summary: According to Jill Hosmer-Jolley, a business lecturer at Cal State Monterey Bay's College of Business, going to AI isn't wrong. Research shows that when students get stumped by an algebra problem, they turn to artificial intelligence tools to help.

articles.title: Sir Paul McCartney warns AI proposed copyright laws overhaul could rip off artists
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: Sir Paul McCartney has warned that AI could 'rip off' artists if a proposed revamp of the copyright regulations by the UK government goes ahead. The use of copyrighted material to train AI models has become the subject of a recently launched government consultation. The UK government is currently consulting on the issue.

articles.summary: Paul McCartney criticises proposed changes to copyright law. UK government is considering changing the law to allow AI to rip off artists. McCartney says it will result in a 'loss of creativity' if it goes ahead.   Â     .

articles.author: Xinhua
articles.summary: The rapid development of China's AI industry has thwarted the U.S. suppression policy, embarrassing American policymakers, according to Xinhua. China has made progress in large-scale language model technology, especially in AI industry. China is a major market for AI technology.

articles.title: AI can ease pressure on ‘overwhelmed' global healthcare systems, Mubadala executive says
articles.author: The National
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence will be used to relieve pressure on public healthcare systems around the world. Mina Hamoodi, head of healthcare at the Abu Dhabi investment company, says the technology will be adopted gradually to advance health care and deal with some of the challenges.

articles.title: Paul McCartney says he fears AI will rip off artists
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: The government is considering allowing tech firms to use copyrighted material for training artificial intelligence in the workplace. It is also considering allowing them to use it for training robots.    for the first time in the history of the world. It would be the first such a move.

articles.title: The Less People Know About AI, the More They Like It
articles.author: Wired
articles.summary: According to research, the least tech-savvy people are the least open to using AI.    People who are least familiar with AI are least likely to be open to AI. iReport.com will share some of the research findings with you.

articles.title: Stargate's first data center is underway in Texas. Public filings show how much it will ...
articles.author: system
articles.summary: President Donald Trump announced the $500 for the Stargate AI infrastructure project. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman is excited about the project and its potential to create AI and AGI in the United States of America. He hopes it will help develop AI technology in the country.

articles.title: Apple makes a change to its AI team and plans Siri upgrades
articles.author: The Verge
articles.summary: Kim Vorrath, who helped get the Vision Pro software out the door and has been at Apple for 36 years, has been brought over to Apple's artificial intelligence and machine learning division. The division is focused on revamping the underlying infrastructure of Siri and improving the company's AI models.

articles.title: Paul McCartney fears artificial intelligence will rip off artists
articles.author: Detroit news
articles.summary: The government is consulting on whether to let tech firms use copyrighted material to help train artificial intelligence models. Paul McCartney has urged the British government not to make a change to copyright laws that could let artificial intelligence companies rip off artists. He says young people can write a song and nobody owns it.

articles.title: Nigeria: Nigerians Behind AI-Driven Brad Pitt $850,000 Romance Scam
articles.author: All Africa
articles.summary: As the story gains traction on social media platforms, the focus has turned to how the scammers could pull off such an elaborate scheme using AI. The story has gained traction on Facebook, Twitter and other platforms and is gaining traction on the Internet.

articles.title: Meta plans to invest R1.1 trn or more in AI this year
articles.author: News24
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg announced Meta's plans to invest at least $60 billion in artificial intelligence in 2025, aiming to lead in the technology. Meta will invest $1.1 trillion in AI by 2025, according to Mark Zuckerberg's statement. Meta is a subsidiary of Facebook.

articles.author: News18

articles.title: Louisiana doctors use artificial intelligence to transcribe and translate visits
articles.author: The Advocate
articles.summary: Ambient artificial intelligence is being used across the United States in hospitals to turn patient conversations into complete notes with real-time insights for doctors. It's a type of AI that solves problems without human intervention and can be used to solve any problem without human help.

articles.author: New York Magazine
articles.summary: There are a lot of rumors about OpenAI's plans for the future. Some of this is a natural consequence of its project: New AI models do things that will change all of our lives forever, according to the company's website.  It's also a result of people being excited about its project.
